SafetyInspectionBy: Baltimore City:  Office of the Fire Marshal

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Motiva Enterprises LLC - Baltimore Terminal Butane Blending System was constructed in accordance with the National Fire Protection Association (NFPA Code) #58 (2004/2008 Edition) for Liquefied Petroleum Gas Storage, and it is the facility's policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state, and local laws/codes.  If an emergency were to occur, it is the facility's policy to notify the Baltimore City Fire Department as well as the Baltimore City/County EMA/LEPC.  Medical emergencies will require notification of the local Emergency Management Services (Medic-5 and Medic-9) and Harbor Hospital.  This facility trains its employees to respond to small or initial stages of an emergency.



The Motiva Enterprises LLC - Baltimore Terminal is a bulk petroleum storage and distribution facility that includes butane blending operations.  This Risk Management Plan (RMP) covers the butane blending system, including the associated piping and one butane storage vessel.



The facility's worst case scenario is the failure of the system's single butane storage vessel when filled to the greatest amount allowed (85% fill shut-off with alarm at 80%) resulting in a vapor cloud explosion.  The facility's alternate release scenario is a "BLEVE" accident and associated fireball.



The Motiva Enterprises LLC - Baltimore Terminal complies with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA) Accident Prevention Rules (40 CFR Part 68 Subpart D), the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) standard (29 CFR Part 1910.119), and all applicable state and local laws and regulations.  The butane blending system is designed, constructed, and maintained in accordance with NFPA #58 and the manufacturer's instructions.



This is a new process, thus this facility has never had an accident involving butane which has resulted in deaths, injuries, property/environmental damage, evacuations or sheltering in place.



In the event of an emergency involving the

Motiva Enterprises LLC - Baltimore Terminal's Butane Blending System, it is the policy of the facility to initially contact the U.S. Coast Guard in addition to the previously mentioned agencies. The facility emergency response plans are coordinated with the fire department and the City of Baltimore Emergency Management Agency.  The Baltimore City Fire Department has participated in the initial RMP/PSM training session for this system.



Motiva intends to integrate process inspection/maintenance requirements into the overall Terminal schedule system.  In addition, Motiva will facilitate periodic emergency exercises with the Fire Department and U.S. Coast Guard, as appropriate.
